newsitem.title: UK: Tories tearing apart over Europe -UK Labour.
newsitem.headline: Tories tearing apart over Europe -UK Labour.

text.p: Labour leader Tony Blair said on Tuesday the Conservatives would be "like ferrets in a sack" over Europe if they won the May 1 election.

Speaking to the party's daily press conference, Blair said: "You can't have strong leadership with a divided Conservative Party. They can't fight for Britain's interests if they are fighting among themselves."
Attacking Conservative divisions, he said that if they won next month "They would be like ferrets in a sack, they'd be tearing themselves apart."

Divisions in the ruling party were highlighted on Tuesday when party vice-chairman Angela Rumbold said she was opposed to a single European curency. Official party policy is to adopt a "wait ans see" stance.
The campaign has also been marked by personal attacks with both sides trading insults over education policy and Europe.

Blair criticised the Conservatives for negative campaigning, saying: "I think they are turning people away from the Conservative Party by this kind of abuse ... No matter what the Tories do, we will carry on with this positive campaign."
